story:
CAMPAIGN UPDATE 4/9/2021

Our campaign ended earlier than intended, so we invite you to check out our website vitanovacreatives.com. For now, it will take you to our newsletter signup, though we are seeing if we can make a carry-over campaign page there. You can also email us at paula@vitanovacreatives.com or message us through our FB page, http://facebook.com/vitanovacreatives, with your backer level and perk desire, and we'll make sure you can contribute and receive your fun perk items! Thank you!

What is Vita Nova Creatives & Coffee?

Vita Nova Creatives & Coffee is a community based artisan boutique and coffee bar located in Northern Virginia. Founded by Paula Millar and her two daughters Danielle Millar and Rebecca Ferguson and her daughter-in-law Jessica Millar in 2020. 

A Note from Paula: 

I was drawn to the name Vita Nova because of it’s meaning: “New Life” and the implications it has on each of our lives as we are entering into new stages and chapters. For me personally, my children have grown and although I’ve always loved art and raising my 4 kids, that stage in life made it difficult for me to find time to pursue the artistic outlets that I love.

We have already begun the process of opening our coffee shop boutique which pairs beautifully all of my passions: my kids, my creativity, and coffee.

Family has always been important to me and I am blessed with the opportunity to operate this store with my two daughters and my daughter-in-law. Our intention is to have our shop feel home-y to the community and to make it a gathering place for the nearby Nokesville, Bristow, and Manassas neighborhoods and businesses and those to our west. We look forward to partnering with the community and providing a service that is not yet available in the area.

Along with family I have always loved treasure hunting and looking for interesting things. I frequent flea markets, auctions, and antique shops to find the diamond in the rough. I enjoy upcycling furniture and breathing new life into old things. I find great joy in creating art on canvases of all kinds beyond the norm and am looking forward to teaching others how to do the same. Vita Nova Creatives & Coffee will be offering a variety of art classes aimed towards various skill levels and artforms.

The last element of our boutique that we are excited to unfold is our coffee bar.  Part of what makes a community great is a place to gather together. Nokesville does not currently have a coffee shop nearby and we are aiming to offer that service. Our location on the corner of Nokesville Rd and Fitzwater Dr will service not only the nearby private and public schools and numerous local businesses, but will also service the large amounts of commuter traffic headed North on Route 28 into DC in the early mornings. We plan to offer drip coffee, espresso drinks, tea, smoothies, and various local baked goods.

Visit our website at www.VitaNovaCreatives.com to sign up for our newsletter and keep updated on our progress!

What We Need & What You Get

We already have funding in place for the basic build-out of our leased spaced. We are working with an architect to ensure we are on the right track to re-zone the location for assembly use for our coffee shop and anticipate beginning to build-out by May. However, we are in need of funds to support our partnership with Crimson Cup - a company we have hired to start up the coffee portion of our store. Our partnership with Crimson Cup and your contributions will fund the following: 

  • Coffee Grinders
  • Espresso Machines
  • Blenders (for frozen drinks and smoothies)
  • Brewers
  • Fridges, freezers, and ice makers
  • Hands-on training of baristas and staff
  • Starting Inventory

We do have a detailed business plan and a complete Proforma laying out all the projected costs and detailing what our first three years could look like, trying to be conservative, and we're very optimistic! The Indiegogo campaign will provide a little less than 30% of the startup costs, and we are securing and self-funding the rest. The 30% provided by the campaign is critically important, and we are so very grateful for your help! 

The Impact

Vita Nova Creatives & Coffee aims to create a space for the members of the nearby communities to gather together. We have a firm belief that community is important and especially in this current time each of us needs a place to escape and relax to. Our boutique styled coffee shop will offer not only coffee and fellowship, but also workshop classes in various art techniques and local vendors. Our goal as a store will be to support small businesses and local artisans and to create something everyone nearby can take ownership in. 

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest risk at this point in time would be falling short on the funds required to purchase the coffee equipment needed to start up the store. We already have a lease on the space and the funding in place for the build-out of the space, but without a successful campaign we are at risk of not being able to immediately install our equipment and therefore our shop will need to open with just the boutique and workshop space until we can manage the funding necessary for working alongside Crimson Cup.  

Other Ways You Can Help

We recognize that not everyone is able to contribute financially to making this project successful, however there are many ways in which you can support us without spending money. First, you can share our fundraiser on your social media accounts. Second, you can pray with and for us for the success of this project and the impact we can have on our community at large. Lastly, send us encouragement to keep on going. Starting a boutique and coffee shop has long been a dream of ours, but seeing the excitement others are getting at the prospect of this store is what is keeping us going and motivating us to try harder than ever to best serve the community. Share with us what you look forward to so we can be excited with you!
story_txt:
CAMPAIGN UPDATE 4/9/2021
Our campaign ended earlier than intended, so we invite you to check out our website vitanovacreatives.com. For now, it will take you to our newsletter signup, though we are seeing if we can make a carry-over campaign page there. You can also email us at paula@vitanovacreatives.com or message us through our FB page, http://facebook.com/vitanovacreatives, with your backer level and perk desire, and we'll make sure you can contribute and receive your fun perk items! Thank you!
What is Vita Nova Creatives & Coffee?
Vita Nova Creatives & Coffee is a community based artisan boutique and coffee bar located in Northern Virginia. Founded by Paula Millar and her two daughters Danielle Millar and Rebecca Ferguson and her daughter-in-law Jessica Millar in 2020. 
A Note from Paula: 
I was drawn to the name Vita Nova because of it’s meaning: “New Life” and the implications it has on each of our lives as we are entering into new stages and chapters. For me personally, my children have grown and although I’ve always loved art and raising my 4 kids, that stage in life made it difficult for me to find time to pursue the artistic outlets that I love.
We have already begun the process of opening our coffee shop boutique which pairs beautifully all of my passions: my kids, my creativity, and coffee.
Family has always been important to me and I am blessed with the opportunity to operate this store with my two daughters and my daughter-in-law. Our intention is to have our shop feel home-y to the community and to make it a gathering place for the nearby Nokesville, Bristow, and Manassas neighborhoods and businesses and those to our west. We look forward to partnering with the community and providing a service that is not yet available in the area.
Along with family I have always loved treasure hunting and looking for interesting things. I frequent flea markets, auctions, and antique shops to find the diamond in the rough. I enjoy upcycling furniture and breathing new life into old things. I find great joy in creating art on canvases of all kinds beyond the norm and am looking forward to teaching others how to do the same. Vita Nova Creatives & Coffee will be offering a variety of art classes aimed towards various skill levels and artforms.
The last element of our boutique that we are excited to unfold is our coffee bar.  Part of what makes a community great is a place to gather together. Nokesville does not currently have a coffee shop nearby and we are aiming to offer that service. Our location on the corner of Nokesville Rd and Fitzwater Dr will service not only the nearby private and public schools and numerous local businesses, but will also service the large amounts of commuter traffic headed North on Route 28 into DC in the early mornings. We plan to offer drip coffee, espresso drinks, tea, smoothies, and various local baked goods.
Visit our website at www.VitaNovaCreatives.com to sign up for our newsletter and keep updated on our progress!

What We Need & What You Get
We already have funding in place for the basic build-out of our leased spaced. We are working with an architect to ensure we are on the right track to re-zone the location for assembly use for our coffee shop and anticipate beginning to build-out by May. However, we are in need of funds to support our partnership with Crimson Cup - a company we have hired to start up the coffee portion of our store. Our partnership with Crimson Cup and your contributions will fund the following: 

Coffee Grinders
Espresso Machines
Blenders (for frozen drinks and smoothies)
Brewers
Fridges, freezers, and ice makers
Hands-on training of baristas and staff
Starting Inventory

We do have a detailed business plan and a complete Proforma laying out all the projected costs and detailing what our first three years could look like, trying to be conservative, and we're very optimistic! The Indiegogo campaign will provide a little less than 30% of the startup costs, and we are securing and self-funding the rest. The 30% provided by the campaign is critically important, and we are so very grateful for your help! 

The Impact
Vita Nova Creatives & Coffee aims to create a space for the members of the nearby communities to gather together. We have a firm belief that community is important and especially in this current time each of us needs a place to escape and relax to. Our boutique styled coffee shop will offer not only coffee and fellowship, but also workshop classes in various art techniques and local vendors. Our goal as a store will be to support small businesses and local artisans and to create something everyone nearby can take ownership in. 

Risks & Challenges
Our biggest risk at this point in time would be falling short on the funds required to purchase the coffee equipment needed to start up the store. We already have a lease on the space and the funding in place for the build-out of the space, but without a successful campaign we are at risk of not being able to immediately install our equipment and therefore our shop will need to open with just the boutique and workshop space until we can manage the funding necessary for working alongside Crimson Cup.  

Other Ways You Can Help
We recognize that not everyone is able to contribute financially to making this project successful, however there are many ways in which you can support us without spending money. First, you can share our fundraiser on your social media accounts. Second, you can pray with and for us for the success of this project and the impact we can have on our community at large. Lastly, send us encouragement to keep on going. Starting a boutique and coffee shop has long been a dream of ours, but seeing the excitement others are getting at the prospect of this store is what is keeping us going and motivating us to try harder than ever to best serve the community. Share with us what you look forward to so we can be excited with you!

story:
Hvorfor ble egentlig Cacao i tusener av år brukt som et sakrament, som valuta og seremoniell medisinplante? Aztecernes mytologi forteller om skapelsesguden Quetzalcoatl, tilsvarende Odin i vår Norrønne tradisjon; Guden for vind, kunnskap, klarsyn og cacao. Deres Ygdrasil; livets tre, var faktisk et cacaotre!

 

//Hvordan bestille?

  • Kjøp en perk! Sender så raskt det er klart; mål om slutten av Mai. 
  • Myrvann = Drikkekakao ---> Alle perks som heter Myrvann er den beskrevne cacaoen i 25g porsjonsklosser. 
  • Nibs, cacaomasse (1/2kg kloss) og bønner er uten adaptogenene, eller andre tilsettninger. 
  • Frother = melkeskummer
  • 250g = 10 kopper cacao
  • Ønsker du en kombo av produkter som krever flere utsjekker? - send en mail! :)

// Et nytt konsept krever et nytt navn! 

 

Vi er ikke i mot kaffe; har bare oppdaget noe mye bedre 

Lei energikrasj, koffeinavhengighet, angst, "jitter" og dårlig søvn? 
Jeg var også en stor kaffedrikker; elsket lukten og ritualet om morgenen.  Men et så kraftig stoff som koffein, som krever påfyll gjennom dagen, var også en avhengighet med klare konsekvenser. Et stoff som jeg forbannet meg over å ha drukket utallige ganger gjennom søvnløse netter. Det måtte finnes et bedre alternativ. - Martin /Grunnlegger 

 

Glem alt du vet om sjokolade

Vi har et brennende ønske om å gi dere en opplevelse av ekte og potent cacao, hver morgen. Produktutviklingen er i god gang, men for å kjøpe første store kvanta med ferske cacaobønner trenger vi litt hjelp, og håper dere vil handle litt på forskudd! 

Cacao er som kjent Gudenes føde, og ettersom "gud" forlengst "er død", er det på høy tid å redefinere cacao fra en ingrediens i godteri og helsedestruerende “kos”, til den enormt næringsrike superfood det egentlig er. Vi vil reintrodusere cacao som et bedre alternativ til kaffe og koffein for energiboost, som et enormt nærende alternativ til søtsaker og som et fantastisk sosialt glidemiddel som alternativ til alkohol. 

I normal cacao-prosessering blir bønnene ristet på høy temperatur, holdt flytende og varmt i lang tid (gjerne mange dager!) og kakaosolider (pulver) og fett blir separert. Dette er mishandling! Myrvann vil være svært forsiktig roasted, litt grovere kvernet enn sjokolade og ikke langtidsmalt, noe som gir en litt syrlig men ikke bitter smak, ha sødme men ikke være søt. Real og ikke ihjel-prossesert.  

Alt vi noen gang kommer til å produsere vil naturlig vis være sukkerfritt!

 

Sammenlignet med konvensjonell kakao (rent kakaopulver eller mørk sjokolade) vil produktet ha like mye til felles som en solseng har med solen, og med Regia "sjokoladedrikk" som mentos har med blåbær.

 

Nå vil vi introdusere et produkt i form av cacaoklosser à en kopp kakao som tilsettes vann eller annen varm væske. En erstatning for kaffe som oppkvikker, et kraftig mineral, antioksidant og energitilskudd. Brikkene vil i tillegg inneholde adaptogene sopp samt lecitin, lett søtning av monkefrukt og himalaya salt. En eliksir kroppen, hjernen og nervesystemet elsker!

  • Kun 20% av koffeininnholdet som kaffe 
  • Theobromin, Anendamide, Phenyletylamin; balansert fokus og hjerteåpnere!
  • 20-25% av dagsbehovet for magnesium pr. kopp!
  • Solid mengde antioksidanter

 

Cacao!

Cacaoen kommer utelukkende fra økologiske småskalaprodusenter som høster fra jungel (agroforestry) hvor symbiosen i økosystemene blir opprettholdt og ikke fra monokulturer og plantasjer. Dette resulterer i en glad, mer potent og smakfull cacao.

Ca 70% av all cacao blir dyrket i kun fire vest-Afrikanske land, primært med en industrielt fremstilt bønne med det deilige navnet "CN51". Denne vokser raskt, er kjempestor og smaker utrolig beskt. For å gjøre historien enda bitrere drives denne industrien fremdeles av bønder som lever under ekstrem fattigdom, slaver og 1.3 millioner barnearbeidere. Prisen på denne cacaoen er ca $2.3 pr kg. Dette for produksjon av luksusvarer fulle av sukker som vesten spiser seg syke på. 

Fra Cocain til Cacao

Cacaoindustrien består heldigvis også av en helt separat side. De siste par tiårene har artisan (småskala) Bean-to-Bar produsenter og forhandlere (tradere) tilnærmet seg lokalbefolkningene med et annet mål for øyet enn storskala industrialisering. De nye foredlerene ville ha økologisk, etisk og eksotisk cacao, med interesse for den gamle cacaokulturen, økosystemene og med større inspirasjon fra vestens vin-tradisjon enn den industrielle revolusjon. Disse nyere økonomiske insjentivene har bla. ført til at områder i Coloumbia, Peru og Boliviasom som tidligere var tungt belastet av trafficking og cocainproduksjon har nå gått over til cacaoproduksjon. Mange bønder har også revet seg løs fra gigantindustrien og fått mulighet til å drive bærekraftig og økologisk. Med en klar intensjon er altså prisene drevet opp for å bidra positivt i utviklingen lokalt hvor cacaoen dyrkes; vi betaler derfor tre til fem ganger mer. Det er det verdt! 

Les gjerne mer på sidene til forhandleren vi har valgt å samarbeide med Silva-Cacao.com  

Cacaosesongene varierer, og utvalget av bønner vil skifte etter hvor den ferskeste cacaoen er tilgjengelig. Etter å ha testet åtte forskjellige bønner har vi landet på fire nylig høstede kandidater for førstegangsproduksjon; 

- India; Idukki - Mild og spennende krydret profil

- Nicaragua; SJM San Pedro - eksklusivt lite parti fra en enkel gård

- Mexico; Chantuto - En ekte Aztecer

- Peru; Ucayali - Ettertraktet urbønne fra dypet av Amazonas

 

Hva er et Adaptogen?

Definisjon; "en ny klasse av metabolske regulatorer (av naturlig opphav) som øker kroppens evne til å tilpasse seg miljømessige faktorer og unngå skade fra disse", altså planter og sopp med (ofte) hormonbalanserende egenskaper som øker vårt vesens adaptive egenskaper, senker stress, styrker immunforsvaret og øker kroppens regenerative egenskaper.

   - Kort sakt; noe som gjør deg sterk og motstandsdyktig mot aldring, sykdom og stress! 

Sopp!

Myrvann Cacao består også av to andre effektfulle skapninger; Lions Mane og Reishi.

I Aztec tradisjon ble "Cacahuatl"(livsblod), altså cacao også drukket i kombinasjon med sopp, men da psilocybin. Enn så lenge er nok denne varianten i meste laget for mattilsynet og byråkrat-strutsen. 
Heldigvis er ikke all sopp med helsegevinster forbudt, og med sine fler tusen år lange tradisjoner i Ayurvedisk og Kinesisk medisin har disse to adaptogene soppene fått en betydelig pouplaritet også i vesten de siste årene. 

Lions Mane - Hericium Erinaceus
En hvit pelsball som på norsk heter "Piggsvinsopp"; vilt-voksende også i Norge men er her rødlistet og forbudt å plukke. Den blir kaldt "østens trøffel" siden det også er en ettertraktet kulinarisk sopp, men som ingrediens i cacao er ikke det formålet. Vi bruker et svært konsentrert ekstrakt som inneholder en gruppe stoffer svært gunstig for kognitiv prestasjon- og helse, som bla. fremmer regenerering av nevroner og myelinering av nervebaner. 

 

Reishi - Ganoderma Lucidum - The plant of Immortality
En annen tresopp med hovedvekt i sin funksjon på immunforsvar og organfunksjon. Den kan også bidra til å senke stress (cortisol-nivå), forbedre søvn og øke mental klarhet gjennom sine antioksidative, antivirale og anti-inflammatoriske egenskaper. 

Mer informasjon og henvisning til forskning vil bli tilgjengelig på nettsidene. 

 

“Vi skal utfordre morgenkaffen med en adaptogen "voksen" kakao; en minimalt prosessert, potent kloss kakaomasse med en spennende smaksprofil, tilsatt adaptogenene Lions Mane og Reishi. Sukkerfri, og som et heftig mineral og kosttilskudd man åpner hjertet, starter hjernen og vedlikeholder vesenet med.”

Hvem er jeg? 

Akkurat det har jeg lurt på en del ganger, men funnet ut at cacao definitivt gjør oppdagelsesferden mer interresant. Min livs-ideologi; “Livet er ikke fett hvis det er for behagelig” tok meg i 2018 ut på en to års jordomseiling på egenhånd. Jeg havnet i Amazonas, og fikk oppleve cacao-frukten på trærne, og fersk cacao. Med mitt betydelige fokus på medisinske planter, kosthold og ernæring, som har vært med meg i mange år, fikk det nye møtet med cacao en kraftig renessanse. Videre på reisen gjennom de Karibiske øyer ble cacao og kulturen rundt, et stort fokus, før jeg seilte tilbake over Nord-Atlanteren sommeren 2020, og ble en del av den sermonielle cacaokulturen i Norge.

Jeg er nå 28 år, og i ferd med å etablere et liv i Rollag i en kultur av unge voksne som ønsker å flytte ut av byen. Jeg ønsker derfor å etablere en bedrift som kan skape arbeidsplasser, økonomisk vekst samt bidra til mat- og kulturtilbudet her i bygda. 

Amazonas 2019  - SailingChilli.com

Selskapet

Cacaoisme AS ble etablert 02.02.21 i Rollag, Numedal

  • Bærekraftig og styrkende for lokalbefolkning og natur lokalt hvor cacaoen dyrkes
  • Økologisk og Fairtrade
  • Seremoniell kvalitet
  • Cacao fra naturlige habitater (agroforestry) og ikke monokultur
  • Stimulere til studier på næringsinnhold og forringelse av cacao samt adaptogenene
  • Kunnskapskilde for cacao, adaptogener og kosttilskudd (relevant for prosjektet)
  • Bidra til bevisstgjøring om skadelighet av alkohol og sukker 
  • Fokus på mental og psykosomatisk helse, immunforsvar, oppvekst og aldring
  • Full transparens fra bonden til koppen

 

Prosessen

  1. Cacao-frukten blir høstet
  2. Fermentert i eget fruktkjøtt 4-6 dager
  3. Tørket 
  4. Seilbåt (I wish) over havet
  5. Roast (ca som kaffe)
  6. Knus og avskalling - Nibs
  7. Finkværning - cacaomasse
  8. Blande inn sopp
  9. Støp 
  10. Flyt!

Ingredienser

Ikke to cacaobønner er like eller smaker likt. Cacao er en levende og mektig plante som må behandles individuelt, og derfor vil ingredienslista og smaksprofil variere kontinuelig. Konkret innholdsliste vil være på etiketten. Alt er naturligvis økologisk- og fairtrade sertifisert, sukker- og soyafritt, lavkarbo og ketovennlig.

  • Cacaomasse
  • Lions Mane (vann + alkohol ekstrakt)
  • Reishi (vann + alkohol ekstrakt)
  • Munkefrukt og/eller Yacon 
  • Solsikke Lecitin  - Superbra for nervebaner!
  • Himalaya salt
  • Einerbær
  • MCT olje

Cacaoen du nå kan glede deg til vil se litt røff ut. Det er fordi den ikke er "temperert", slik som sjokolade. Den vil være "bloomed", altså ha hvite områder og boblemønstre. Det er slik sjokolade ser ut, og har ingenting med holdbarhet å gjøre; kun hvordan den er avkjølt. 

Partnere

Heldigvis er jeg ikke alene med ønsket om cacaofabrikk i Rollag. Mine venner (bla.) i bygda har bidratt med midler til prosessen hittil og fremtidig trygghet for etablering. 

  • Kværna AS
  • Numedal Middelaldersenter
  • RO - Rollag Opplevelser

Vite mer?

Send gjerne en mail eller melding! :) - Cacaoisme@gmail.com

// Martin

 

En herlig dokumentar rundt cacaokulturen i Guatemala

De siste par tiårene har artisan (småskala) Bean-to-Bar produsenter og forhandlere (tradere) tilnærmet seg lokalbefolkningene med et annet mål for øyet enn storskala industrialisering. De nye foredlerene ville ha økologisk, etisk og eksotisk cacao, med interesse for den gamle cacaokulturen, økosystemene og med større inspirasjon fra vestens vin-tradisjon enn den industrielle revolusjon. Disse nyere økonomiske insjentivene har bla. ført til at områder i Coloumbia, Peru og Boliviasom som tidligere var tungt belastet av trafficking og cocainproduksjon har nå gått over til cacaoproduksjon. Mange bønder har også revet seg løs fra gigantindustrien og fått mulighet til å drive bærekraftig og økologisk. Med en klar intensjon er altså prisene drevet opp for å bidra positivt i utviklingen lokalt hvor cacaoen dyrkes; vi betaler derfor tre til fem ganger mer. Det er det verdt! Les gjerne mer på sidene til forhandleren vi har valgt å samarbeide med Silva-Cacao.com  Cacaosesongene varierer, og utvalget av bønner vil skifte etter hvor den ferskeste cacaoen er tilgjengelig. Etter å ha testet åtte forskjellige bønner har vi landet på fire nylig høstede kandidater for førstegangsproduksjon; - India; Idukki - Mild og spennende krydret profil- Nicaragua; SJM San Pedro - eksklusivt lite parti fra en enkel gård- Mexico; Chantuto - En ekte Aztecer- Peru; Ucayali - Ettertraktet urbønne fra dypet av Amazonas Hva er et Adaptogen?Definisjon; "en ny klasse av metabolske regulatorer (av naturlig opphav) som øker kroppens evne til å tilpasse seg miljømessige faktorer og unngå skade fra disse", altså planter og sopp med (ofte) hormonbalanserende egenskaper som øker vårt vesens adaptive egenskaper, senker stress, styrker immunforsvaret og øker kroppens regenerative egenskaper.   - Kort sakt; noe som gjør deg sterk og motstandsdyktig mot aldring, sykdom og stress! Sopp!Myrvann Cacao består også av to andre effektfulle skapninger; Lions Mane og Reishi.I Aztec tradisjon ble "Cacahuatl"(livsblod), altså cacao også drukket i kombinasjon med sopp, men da psilocybin. Enn så lenge er nok denne varianten i meste laget for mattilsynet og byråkrat-strutsen. Heldigvis er ikke all sopp med helsegevinster forbudt, og med sine fler tusen år lange tradisjoner i Ayurvedisk og Kinesisk medisin har disse to adaptogene soppene fått en betydelig pouplaritet også i vesten de siste årene. Lions Mane - Hericium ErinaceusEn hvit pelsball som på norsk heter "Piggsvinsopp"; vilt-voksende også i Norge men er her rødlistet og forbudt å plukke. Den blir kaldt "østens trøffel" siden det også er en ettertraktet kulinarisk sopp, men som ingrediens i cacao er ikke det formålet. Vi bruker et svært konsentrert ekstrakt som inneholder en gruppe stoffer svært gunstig for kognitiv prestasjon- og helse, som bla. fremmer regenerering av nevroner og myelinering av nervebaner.  Reishi - Ganoderma Lucidum - The plant of ImmortalityEn annen tresopp med hovedvekt i sin funksjon på immunforsvar og organfunksjon. Den kan også bidra til å senke stress (cortisol-nivå), forbedre søvn og øke mental klarhet gjennom sine antioksidative, antivirale og anti-inflammatoriske egenskaper. Mer informasjon og henvisning til forskning vil bli tilgjengelig på nettsidene.  “Vi skal utfordre morgenkaffen med en adaptogen "voksen" kakao; en minimalt prosessert, potent kloss kakaomasse med en spennende smaksprofil, tilsatt adaptogenene Lions Mane og Reishi. Sukkerfri, og som et heftig mineral og kosttilskudd man åpner hjertet, starter hjernen og vedlikeholder vesenet med.”Hvem er jeg? Akkurat det har jeg lurt på en del ganger, men funnet ut at cacao definitivt gjør oppdagelsesferden mer interresant. Min livs-ideologi; “Livet er ikke fett hvis det er for behagelig” tok meg i 2018 ut på en to års jordomseiling på egenhånd. Jeg havnet i Amazonas, og fikk oppleve cacao-frukten på trærne, og fersk cacao. Med mitt betydelige fokus på medisinske planter, kosthold og ernæring, som har vært med meg i mange år, fikk det nye møtet med cacao en kraftig renessanse. Videre på reisen gjennom de Karibiske øyer ble cacao og kulturen rundt, et stort fokus, før jeg seilte tilbake over Nord-Atlanteren sommeren 2020, og ble en del av den sermonielle cacaokulturen i Norge.Jeg er nå 28 år, og i ferd med å etablere et liv i Rollag i en kultur av unge voksne som ønsker å flytte ut av byen. Jeg ønsker derfor å etablere en bedrift som kan skape arbeidsplasser, økonomisk vekst samt bidra til mat- og kulturtilbudet her i bygda. Amazonas 2019  - SailingChilli.comSelskapetCacaoisme AS ble etablert 02.02.21 i Rollag, Numedal
Bærekraftig og styrkende for lokalbefolkning og natur lokalt hvor cacaoen dyrkes
Økologisk og Fairtrade
Seremoniell kvalitet
Cacao fra naturlige habitater (agroforestry) og ikke monokultur
Stimulere til studier på næringsinnhold og forringelse av cacao samt adaptogenene
Kunnskapskilde for cacao, adaptogener og kosttilskudd (relevant for prosjektet)
Bidra til bevisstgjøring om skadelighet av alkohol og sukker 
Fokus på mental og psykosomatisk helse, immunforsvar, oppvekst og aldring
Full transparens fra bonden til koppen
 Prosessen
Cacao-frukten blir høstet
Fermentert i eget fruktkjøtt 4-6 dager
Tørket 
Seilbåt (I wish) over havet
Roast (ca som kaffe)
Knus og avskalling - Nibs
Finkværning - cacaomasse
Blande inn sopp
Støp 
Flyt!
IngredienserIkke to cacaobønner er like eller smaker likt. Cacao er en levende og mektig plante som må behandles individuelt, og derfor vil ingredienslista og smaksprofil variere kontinuelig. Konkret innholdsliste vil være på etiketten. Alt er naturligvis økologisk- og fairtrade sertifisert, sukker- og soyafritt, lavkarbo og ketovennlig.
Cacaomasse
Lions Mane (vann + alkohol ekstrakt)
Reishi (vann + alkohol ekstrakt)
Munkefrukt og/eller Yacon 
Solsikke Lecitin  - Superbra for nervebaner!
Himalaya salt
Einerbær
MCT olje
Cacaoen du nå kan glede deg til vil se litt røff ut. Det er fordi den ikke er "temperert", slik som sjokolade. Den vil være "bloomed", altså ha hvite områder og boblemønstre. Det er slik sjokolade ser ut, og har ingenting med holdbarhet å gjøre; kun hvordan den er avkjølt. PartnereHeldigvis er jeg ikke alene med ønsket om cacaofabrikk i Rollag. Mine venner (bla.) i bygda har bidratt med midler til prosessen hittil og fremtidig trygghet for etablering. 
Kværna AS
Numedal Middelaldersenter
RO - Rollag Opplevelser
Vite mer?Send gjerne en mail eller melding! :) - Cacaoisme@gmail.com// Martin En herlig dokumentar rundt cacaokulturen i Guatemala

story:
Welcome to  our Project The Send A seed Women’s Project Kabale Uganda.

I am Hope Kemirembe the leader of the project.The project is based in rural area of Kabale  District.

The project was started by we the women peasants in Mparo Parish,Rwamucucu Sub-county Rukiga-Kabale in South western Uganda.

The purpose of the project is to make sure the indigenous good seeds which reproduce good seeds are not made to diminish by the organizations promoting and selling genetically modified seeds which cannot produce seeds but make the peasant continue buying seeds every time of planting.

It also serves as source of food for the participants as well as selling extra as an income generating project

It also helps directly and indirectly promotes plant food against people destroying animals as source of food.

We also use natural organic farmyard manure that does not contain chemicals and which improves soils.

So in September 2018 we started the project as three women .Now we have grown in number to 20.Had it not been the break out of COVID-19 pandemic we could by now have even reached 40 but because of the COVID-19 we had last year to share most of the seeds with others living in town who were under lock-down and had no source of food as the promised food from Government was not provided. We started with bean and maize seeds in that once a home has a good harvest of these two seeds it can have a reasonable diet source and food security. Especially so in times like this during the COVID-19 pandemic where nutritious food is key to survive the virus.

With SEND A SEED. The women peasants, who are provided seeds, grow them and on harvesting they provide the same amount of seeds that they were given, to another woman peasant each. Then use the remaining as seeds and some as for food and extra sold for income to cater for other basic needs of the families.Hence the name SEND A SEED.

20 kilograms of seeds yield approximately 100 kilogrammes on harvesting.

Bean seeds cost Uganda Shs 3000/- per kilogram while Maize seeds cost Uganda Shs 2000/- per kilogram

20 Kgs of Bean seeds cost Uganda Shs 60,000/- while 20 kgs Maize seeds cost 40,000/- .Totaling to Uganda Shillings 100,000/- (One hundred thousands).This makes the package for  one woman.

We wish to increase the number of SEND A SEED members by 40 thus having a sixty women members  which will enable them multiply the seeds quickly on harvesting and giving the same amount of seeds each woman to another woman who then joins the group.

To provide such an amount to 40 women peasants

40x 100,000/- = 4,000,000/= (Uganda Shillings Four millions)

Equivalent to Euros 1000

This is the amount we are fundraising for.

Contribute Using the Back it Button on the fundraising page.

 

Contact me through:  Tel +256789434106

                                    E-Mail: hopekemirembe4@gmail.com

                                    Facebook: https://facebook.com/hope.kemirembemoreen

story:
Enjoy the messiest burgers, mess-free! Burger Buddy is an interactive, hygienic, and eco-friendly way to hold your burger together, and keep all of the fixings inside!
 
 
 
 

Bagels, Doughnuts, Pies, and so much more!

 

Enjoy a juicy burger, a packed bagel, a sugary doughnut (and more!) mess-free with the handy Burger Buddy. This hygienic, eco-friendly solution keeps your snack intact, off your laps, and germ-free.

Burger Buddy stops germs from spreading by minimising hands-on contact with the food, preventing germs from spreading. The last third of the food item can simply be pushed out from the bottom.

Burger Buddy saves you from using excessive napkins. On average it saves 2-3 paper napkins per burger, which saves you money and saves the planet!

 

Burger Buddy even expands for extra patties and more fillings, the elastic gussets of Burger Buddy firmly holds the burger and the fillings together.

 Easy use for children, the elderly, and people with disabilities, such as Arthritis, Parkinson's, or any type of ailment that may keep them from holding food steady.

 

The ultra-smooth inner surface makes cleaning simple, sauces and crumbs glide out from each end of the gusset.   

 

Burger Buddy is not just a product, but the first step to a cleaner you and a cleaner environment!

 Follow us & share on

 For media & inquiries, email info@burger-buddy.com

story:
Just over six years ago Anthony Castaneda and Brian Hand set out to bring delicious and locally produced craft beer to our stomping grounds of Chatsworth. This wild ride isn't over yet, and now, with all your help we plan to open up our own pizza kitchen.
 

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • We have a goal of $30k here on Indiegogo, that money plus coupled with initial funding in place should be enough for the build out and any permits related to opening our own kitchen
  • There are a myriad of choices when it comes to how much you are able to support. We will have a bunch of perks that come along with it from stickers and shirts all the way up to designing a pizza or even a collaboration brew day with our brew staff!
  • Even if we fall short of our goal of $30k, the money will still go towards the build out of a pizza kitchen. This is the way.

The Impact

In addition to all the perks you get with the different levels of support, this pizza kitchen opens up a lot of opportunities for us at Hand-Brewed Beer. A "bona-fides eatery" with our type-23 ABC license means we can serve wines and ciders. Most importantly it means we could also serve guest taps or, even better, serve up collaboration brews with other breweries!

Risks & Challenges

Obviously a foray into a kitchen is something new for us at Hand-Brewed Beer. We plan to work with the right team to ensure buildout is to-code and that we work with a team to cook up only the best pizza for our loyal patrons.

With the insight of brewery friends Macleod Ale Brew Co and Pocock Brewing Company, we feel blessed to have inside knowledge into starting this kitchen.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone these days are in a position to give money to a cause that isn't rent or food on the table. You can still help by spreading the word and sharing our Indiegogo campaign.

story:
Whether you’re on the mountain or at the home office, these products are made with plant-based ingredients designed to elevate your focus and boost your body’s resilience.

The biggest thing that we’ve found when trying all of these ‘healthy’ drinks was that they tasted terrible. While it’s nice to feel good about drinking something every day, it’s also nice not to have to choke it down. So, we came up with some rules for any functional drinks we were going to make:

It took us YEARS to develop just the right blend, and we're really proud of it. The organic matcha is from Japan. The organic coffee is from Mexico. The ingredients for the Immunity + Focus blend are simple, delicious, and combined for maximum efficacy: coconut creamer that doesn't taste like coconut and is loaded with MCT's, a reishi and lion's mane mushroom extract that has been certified to be 70% β-glucan, and vitamins A and D from lichen to keep our product vegan.

What are MCT's?

Medium-Chain Triglycerides (MCT's) are a quick, natural source of fuel for your brain. Most of the fats we eat are long-chain fatty acids and can take a long time to be broken down and used as fuel. When MCT's are consumed, they go to the liver, where it breaks them down to carbohydrates or ketones that your body uses for energy.

What are β-glucans?

β-glucans are polysaccharides that occur naturally in the cellular walls of mushrooms like Reishi or Lion's Mane. They are soluble fibers with a lot of powerful benefits including support for your immune system, cholesterol levels and blood sugar.

How about Vitamins D + A? What do they do?

Vitamin D plays a vital role in supporting immune function and cell growth. Interesting fact, most Vitamin D supplements are made from Sheep's Wool. We use a Vitamin D that is sourced from lichen (crazy, right?) to keep it vegan.

Vitamin A supports immune function as well as your vision!

Alpine Start was conceived on an expedition to the Bugaboos in Canada. Matt wanted a great tasting instant coffee that he could take on climbing expeditions when he needed to go light and fast. 

 

He enlisted his friend, Alex Hanifin, on the project, and they created their first product, Original Blend, a medium-roast that is delicious, affordable, quick, and easy-to-use. 

 

Then, things took a turn for the worse. In 2017, while training for an expedition to the Himalaya, Matt took a big fall while paragliding in California. He broke a bunch of bones and was laid up for months. 

Mike Crouch, who had started working at Alpine Start, made up some of his functional coffees for Matt, playing with different ingredients like CBD, mushrooms, and MCT’s. 

 

Post splatt (as we like to say), Matt was looking to get back to peak performance. This was when he realized he wanted more out of his coffee than to wake him up and uh… speed up his digestion. 

 

Mike and Matt spent the next couple of years working on various formulas, testing them on their own adventures, and using Matt’s other athlete friends as guinea pigs (thanks, team!). 

 

Fun. That’s really what we’re all about. We’re making coffee here, people, not saving the world. We try to get work done early so we can get outside. If it snowed last night, we’re the first ones on the hill to get some fresh turns. 

That said, as outdoor adventurers, we’re committed to protecting the places we love to play. 

We want to make the world a better place through Alpine Start and strongly believe in giving back through service and financial support. We’ve worked with numerous organizations that help to make the outdoors more accessible and equitable. In addition, we’re proud members of 1% For the Planet and a Brand Partner with Protect Our Winters.

story:
Who are we: 

My Dad and I are a nerdy and goofy Father/Daughter duo working together to bring a small summer village their first high-end donut shop and bakery. Our dream has been to one day open our own bakery, stemming from our backgrounds in baking. Our family has grown up spending weekends and holidays at Pigeon Lake and we consider it to be our second home. My Dad and I are extremely passionate and driven to support our Lake community. Our goal is to keep it local! All fresh fruits, honey and herbs will be supplied by farmers and businesses in the area so we can all help drive the economy. 

Meet Dan: Dan is a creative and fun-loving guy who always seeks opportunities to turn a fascinating craft or hobby into something more. He has an extensive background in business and will be leading as Head of Operations and Lead Baker. Dan spends his down-time building miniature fantasy-themed dioramas. Dan is incredibly eager to meet his customers. You won’t catch him ever shying away from a chat, and the jokes won’t stop comin’! 

Meet Sabrina: Young and aspiring, Sabrina brings her creativity and passion to her baking. When she is not online with her friends or playing Dungeons and Dragons, her spare time consists of experimenting with flavors and textures to make something truly unique to the consumer.  Sabrina gets her outgoing nature from Dan, and together, they are sure to keep the atmosphere lively!

 

Our Mission: 

Our mission is to provide a small rural community with their first gourmet bakery. We are excited to collaborate with neighboring businesses in support of all the services that Pigeon Lake and the surrounding areas have to offer. 

In addition to supporting the local economy, we value the environment, striving to be as plastic and paper-free as possible. That means using recyclable or compostable packaging, digital recipes in the bakery and e-receipts for customers. 

 

Our Products:

While our main focus is our specialty donuts, we also want to produce unique novelties such as cookies, squares, cupcakes, and cereal treats. As our business grows and we start seeing success, our goal will be to start introducing custom orders, cakes, and bulk products.

 

How You’re Helping:

With each dollar donated, you will be helping us pay for our bakery equipment, building renovations, ingredient costs, starting wages, as well as costs of operation. Your support will mean that we will have more budget to produce more and better products as well as helping ensure we are able to get started on opening that much sooner and let’s face it, no one wants to wait for donuts.

 

Risks & Challenges:

Opening a bakery is tough at the best of times, never mind during Covid. We are taking special considerations to make sure we can open up with all the necessary precautions and requirements. 

 

Our biggest obstacle will be managing production and making sure we can make the very best products for our customers. In an area with little to no competition, it will be difficult to gauge how much traffic we will generate, but we are eager and determined to succeed nonetheless. We are both passionate and driven individuals and we will be learning and growing throughout our journey together to give our clients the best bakery experience possible.

My Dad and I are a nerdy and goofy Father/Daughter duo working together to bring a small summer village their first high-end donut shop and bakery. Our dream has been to one day open our own bakery, stemming from our backgrounds in baking. Our family has grown up spending weekends and holidays at Pigeon Lake and we consider it to be our second home. My Dad and I are extremely passionate and driven to support our Lake community. Our goal is to keep it local! All fresh fruits, honey and herbs will be supplied by farmers and businesses in the area so we can all help drive the economy. 
Meet Dan: Dan is a creative and fun-loving guy who always seeks opportunities to turn a fascinating craft or hobby into something more. He has an extensive background in business and will be leading as Head of Operations and Lead Baker. Dan spends his down-time building miniature fantasy-themed dioramas. Dan is incredibly eager to meet his customers. You won’t catch him ever shying away from a chat, and the jokes won’t stop comin’! 
Meet Sabrina: Young and aspiring, Sabrina brings her creativity and passion to her baking. When she is not online with her friends or playing Dungeons and Dragons, her spare time consists of experimenting with flavors and textures to make something truly unique to the consumer.  Sabrina gets her outgoing nature from Dan, and together, they are sure to keep the atmosphere lively!
 
Our Mission: 
Our mission is to provide a small rural community with their first gourmet bakery. We are excited to collaborate with neighboring businesses in support of all the services that Pigeon Lake and the surrounding areas have to offer. 
In addition to supporting the local economy, we value the environment, striving to be as plastic and paper-free as possible. That means using recyclable or compostable packaging, digital recipes in the bakery and e-receipts for customers. 
 
Our Products:
While our main focus is our specialty donuts, we also want to produce unique novelties such as cookies, squares, cupcakes, and cereal treats. As our business grows and we start seeing success, our goal will be to start introducing custom orders, cakes, and bulk products.
 
How You’re Helping:
With each dollar donated, you will be helping us pay for our bakery equipment, building renovations, ingredient costs, starting wages, as well as costs of operation. Your support will mean that we will have more budget to produce more and better products as well as helping ensure we are able to get started on opening that much sooner and let’s face it, no one wants to wait for donuts.
 
Risks & Challenges:
Opening a bakery is tough at the best of times, never mind during Covid. We are taking special considerations to make sure we can open up with all the necessary precautions and requirements. 
 
Our biggest obstacle will be managing production and making sure we can make the very best products for our customers. In an area with little to no competition, it will be difficult to gauge how much traffic we will generate, but we are eager and determined to succeed nonetheless. We are both passionate and driven individuals and we will be learning and growing throughout our journey together to give our clients the best bakery experience possible.

story:
About

ZTRAW is the perfect reusable solution to enjoy your favorite beverage with style. Suitable for both hot and cold drinks, it can withstand temperature from 0 to 100°C. It also solves the biggest issues faced by reusable straws; portability and hygiene. Just open it up to clean every corner and fold it back up to carry it with you anywhere. 

...And there you have it!

 

A Revolutionary ZTRAW of this Decade

 

So, Why did we create ZTRAW?

 

But... You might ask, so why ZTRAW?

 

It's A Game-Changer.

 

Easy to Carry

Take it anywhere in your pocket

 

Easy to Fold

Easy assembly and smooth suction

 

Easy clean textured surface for an easy wipe with anti-microbial compound to protect ZTRAW from bacterial build-up

 

Unfold to rinse or put in the dishwasher for a thorough wash

 

Hot or cold, thick or thin, any beverage of your choice!

 

Stay Stylish, Stay Woke 

 

World's Slimmest ZTRAW 

 

Keep Up with Us!

 

Rewards 

 

https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/ztraw/flipen-a-foldable-pen-combining-writing-and-bookma

story:
Juno is like a reverse microwave but for cooling. 

We first set out to create a product that would quickly and conveniently chill both white AND red wine to sommelier-recommended temperatures. How many times have you had a guest bring over a bottle of wine without having a convenient way to quickly chill it? We knew we could solve this problem. So, we built the latest technology in thermoelectric cooling into Juno to rapidly chill a full sized bottle of white wine to 50º F in 3 minutes, and a bottle of beer in less than 1 minute.

What we discovered along the way was that Juno can do so much more than just chill wine. It can turn your freshly brewed coffee cold, transform your hot tea into iced tea, and cool your favorite beer or soda, right in the can. 

 

Tom's Guide, MSN, Tech Republic, The Telegraph, Tech We Like, Wired

 

 

Chill a bottle of wine to sommelier-recommended temperatures in a matter of minutes.

 

In addition to wine, you can chill any other type of beverage you desire: beer, champagne, juice, soda, coffee, tea, etc.

 

The universal design allows for just about any type of beverage bottle or vessel to be placed inside for rapid cooling. From a can of soda to a bottle of champagne, Juno can accommodate a wide variety of containers.

 

Juno’s futuristic LED status bar tells you visually when your beverage is ready.

 

 

The sleek, modern design complements any kitchen or bar countertop.

It's made from premium materials and will come in custom color options.

 

The three simple and programmable buttons come preset for the perfect red or white wine temperatures, and are also customizable so you can choose your preferred level of
chilling. Once Juno has been initiated, it's always on and ready for another bottle.

 

Juno uses innovative MATRIX-powered thermoelectric technology to rapidly cool your drinks, without the use of noisy compressors or harmful chemical refrigerants.

 


 

Juno’s family of elegant tumblers allows you to cool your morning juice, tea, or coffee, and immediately take it with you on the go.

Imagine brewing a hot pot of coffee, pouring it into your to-go tumbler, chilling it in Juno for a couple minutes, and then you are out the door with a refreshing and freshly brewed iced coffee. No need to water your drink down with ice or wait for it to cool for hours in the fridge. Available in 16oz or 32oz capacity, and you can chill the 16oz numbers two at a time!

 

 

With its always-on MATRIX technology, Juno is ready to chill whenever you are.

Simply place your beverage of choice inside, initiate the cold cycle, and Juno immediately begins to rapidly chill to your desired temperature. This saves you precious refrigerator space and time, making it perfect for entertaining.

story:
Toma Mojo Grill is opening THIS SUMMER. We've launched this campaign to initiate our friends, family, neighbors and future patrons into our clubs, offer early-bird opportunities to score exclusive merch, and the opportunity to be the pioneering participants in some pretty unique perks. We're ready to get the fun started!

Toma Mojo Grill is all about bright, fresh flavors served in a variety of healthy ways with meal options that are great for one, two or a crowd! We love mojo marinated chicken served on sandwiches, bone-in plates with tasty sides, or whole roast chicken dinners for the entire family! Pulled pork, vegetarian dishes and flavorful sides make sure there is something for everyone.   Hot, spicy, tangy, smoky and cooling sauces are served on the side to kick things up. Mix and match to create your own flavor experience!

Say hello to the west metro’s newest fast casual restaurant! Toma Mojo Grill is located just off 394 and Plymouth Road, west of Ridgedale Center, and in the same complex as Second Swing. Toma Mojo Grill features a 75-seat dining room, 25 seat patio and a 6-seat counter. Regional tap beer, organic wine, canned adult beverages and a selection of house made Sangria will be served to accompany the food or to be enjoyed on its own! 

With over 30 years of cumulative hospitality experience, from fast food chains to award winning neighborhood bistros, Paul Backer and Michael Knox are excited to bring Toma Mojo Grill to Minnetonka. The two partners met almost a decade ago at famed neighborhood restaurant Tilia as part of the opening crew. Paul worked his way up from a kitchen support staff position to Chef Du Cuisine, while Mike worked his way up from a bartending position to General Manager. With the help of several friends and family members, Toma Mojo Grill has been in development for several years.

“Toma Mojo Grill is a fast casual restaurant with a focus on Mediterranean flavors from Spain and Portugal. This cuisine features fresh flavors that are lightly smoky, highly craveable, and a naturally-healthy, better-for-you option.” – Paul Backer  

“I’m excited to present Toma Mojo Grill’s food and beverages in a fun and welcoming setting. Our service goal is to serve real food fast with a guest experience that doesn’t end at the order counter. We want our guests to experience Toma Mojo Grill in a way that works for them; be it a quick lunch, afternoon drinks with friends, or a group dinner.” – Michael Knox

story:
OVERVIEW

FOODTRKNETWORK is an online platform that provides real-time location updates for food truck vendors and their customers. The platform features a map that allows customers to see the locations of the nearest food trucks and the menu they offer, providing easy access to food options with the provision of automatically synced, real-time location of food trucks in the area they are parked.

Apart from Geo-location services we will have a unique selling proposition, other services to make it stand out in the available small niche of competition. Such services include 'Vendor of the week', a weekly service that will provide different spotlight trucks per week, and VIP vendor options for trucks, Also we are looking into hosting Food truck rodeos and other events.

FOODTRKNETWORK will also offer advertising opportunities on the platform and a dedicated YouTube Channel to promote the brand and contains an advertisement for interested people or firms

The platform will have the vendor's profile, which includes the name, avatar, contact information, gallery of available menu options, and the truck's current location seen as the vendor's avatar. It will also include the user's basic profile and location

 

 

FOODTRKNETWORK will pick up in Greensboro, North Carolina, and would at first focus on Raleigh, Durham, Charlotte as well, all cities in North Carolina. In the long run, FOODTRKNETWORK will expand to provide national allocation services for food truck vendors


MISSION

  • The mission of the establishment is to provide the location details of available food trucks, their real-time location and a wide range of food options

  • FOODTRKNETWORK is dedicated to providing the citizen with an easy-to-use platform to locate food trucks in their area

 

 

THE PROBLEM

We've all experienced the frustration of searching for, but not finding, a Food Truck.

Everyone eats, and a large percentage of people prefer to use food trucks. The market has a growing number of food vendors in the target areas, and the customers are sometimes disappointed when they cannot find the location of their favorite food trucks

 

THE SOLUTION

The search is over... literally. Find the best food trucks around, using real-time GPS! With FOODTRKNETWORK APP

Through our services, you can locate all the best vendors any time they’re open. You can contact them through the app, browse their menus, check out their social media, and book a vendor for your catered event. With our app, you now have the best way to find what you're looking for.

The main selling point of FOODTRKNETWORK's is its maps. These maps will let the customers see the locations of registered food trucks in real-time. Each user will see the nearest food trucks to him/her and their available food menu, giving such users easy access to food choices and easy navigation to the truck's location.

ABOUT US

 

The company's founder and sole proprietor, JORDAN MASSEY, is young and immersed in the financial markets. I regularly eat at food trucks and has attended several food truck events. It is one such event that I realized how a food truck locator could unify all stakeholders in the food industry and help customers quickly locate the trucks while giving them food options.

I have done much research in the industry. While attending food truck events and patronizing these vendors, I build relationships and connections with the food truck owners. I have provided many vendors with a business description and a logo.

My years of experience with social media platforms (Twitter, Instagram, TikTok, Facebook, and LinkedIn) and a website will boost the firm's online presence. I will make total use of social media platforms, especially TikTok, to grow the business's audience. FOODTRKNETWORK will solve a problem and fulfill a need in the food industry.

OFFER

WHAT WE OFFER CUSTOMERS

 

Each customer will see the nearest food trucks to him/her and their available food menu, giving such users easy access to food choices and easy navigation to the truck's location on the app for free

  • Find the best food trucks, near or far
  • Receive special deals & discounts
  • Get notified of local events & festivals
  • Great for booking catering & special events

 

WHAT WE OFFER VENDORS

Our focus is providing tools for you to market yourself and increase your sales

Tracking for Mobile Vendors

 

When you tap OPEN, you send notifications to nearby foodies, and you mark your exact location with GPS. Customers see your profile with pictures, a description, deals, daily specials, and upcoming events, so new customers discover you and your food.

Sign up to join our Newsletter for update |  https://www.foodtrknetwork.com/

 

Widespread Marketing across Many Platforms

Profiles are linked to your social media, review-sites, your calendar, and your website, making it easy for customers to access and share your brand across multiple platforms.

Apply for Vendor APP early access & Reserve your Spot. You Will Have Beta Access to Our Upcoming iOS App   @   https://www.foodtrknetwork.com/beta

 

WHAT WE OFFER INVESTORS & BUSINESS OWNERS

 

 We will offers vast opportunities for business owner, investors, private individual to showcase their business to several potential customers and vendors through advertisement

An online presence to boost business growth and increase brand awareness.

Your reliable source to find food trucks now!

 

CAMPAIGN OBJECTIVE

WHAT WE NEED

Right now, we are turning to you for helping to raise the funds that we need to improve and enhance the app, implementation, and market to a global audience.

Our goal through this campaign is to raise $8,000. What we are asking from you today is an open heart, open donation, and helping hands. All of the funds will be used to provide:

  • Legal fees
  • Official Website (foodtrknetwork.com) design and Maintenance
  • App design and backend
  • Business plan
  • Advertising and Merchandise
  • Travel

Even the smallest of contributions will make a big difference for us - for every pledge, above $5 we will send a Personal Thank you email to you as a token of appreciation along with other rewards given for the donation.

 

 

WHAT YOU GET

Below I've detailed what you'll receive based upon your donation to this campaign

Pledge $25 or more

Receive access to special updates

FTN will keep you updated by providing an all access behind the scenes pass within development and FTN food truck videos!

 

 

Pledge $50 or more

Beta Tester! Get your hands on the app

You are granted access to beta testing. Meaning you’ll be one of the first ones with the App!

Includes

  •  Behind the scenes footage and development process
  •  Beta Tester!

 

Pledge $100 or more

Face Time or Zoom Call & IG Shout out

Receive a phone call, Face Time or zoom call from the founder of FTN to thank you personally for donating and believing in our company!

I

 

 

 Pledge $200 or more

Merchandise & More!

We are very thankful for your donation! In return we will send you a commemorative contributor plaque and an exclusive shirt only given to our team members along with other merchandise!

 

 

Pledge $500 or more

Have an Update named after you

You will forever be a part of our creating process with your name engraved and etched into our footprint. Thank you for believing in us.

 

 

Pledge $1,000 or more

 

Top Contributor Status

We can’t couldn’t be anymore grateful! You will be featured among our top contributors and also have a direct line of email to add your suggestions and comments to our staff and developers.

 

IMPACT

 

It will provide a solution to the current economic crisis looming on the world retail market by helping customers locate a vendor for their favorite food also increase sales for potential vendor users.

Cost and effective way of marketing to future clients.

 

 

 

RISK AND CHALLENGES

  • The main challenge we will be facing is getting vendors on to a subscription plan. Our interns are working around the clock to help market FTN to as many vendors as possible.

 

  • As with most crowd funding projects, there may be some unexpected circumstances and or scenarios; but our team is fully prepared to take on any challenges by virtue of our full preparedness and crowd funding experience. If we do run into any logistical challenges so significant that may delay us, we will be sure to keep all our contributors in the loop

 

Other Ways You Can Help

In addition to supporting this project with your donation, You can also show your support by sharing a link to this campaign on Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, and any other social media platforms you use. The more people that are aware the more it will make this campaign a success.

We appreciate all your support, both monetary and non-monetary, and we thank you for taking the time to read about what we are doing

story:
We are OFFERING OUR PILOT RUN SAMPLE BARS AS PERKS to share the love, get more feedback and to show the interest in the market.   

Our 1st test pilot run was SUCCESSFUL! We are branded, 3rd party tested, doctor approved and ready to roll!  I am a cancer survivor on a mission to provide transparent nutrient dense Bone Broth Collagen Bars/Snacks with 14+ grams of protein, 8 grams of grass-fed collagen and only 2g-3g of sugar from organic sources. 

I need a low sugar diet, and ingredients like Rice and Gums run havoc on my gut! I also drink bone broth collagen every morning like a cup of coffee. My friends and family wanted to have the bone broth nutrients but were not going to drink it like a soup. I started to look on the market for solutions and I couldn't find anything and so YONDER was born! Why not bring a passion for healthy snacks to reality for the whole world to enjoy!

What You Get

  • You can get our PILOT RUN bars right away, 2 flavors available: Wild Blueberry Nut & Coconut Almond.

We Care

We care about you, your health, the environment, and ensuring the transparency and quality of our products. Paying it forward for generations to come! We use clean renewable sustainable solar energy to make these bars and support organic farming.

Sheri & Hanna, true Health Nerds

Follow us on Instagram

 

Benefits of Bone Broth Collagen

Our Story

I was diagnosed with Hodgkin’s Lymphoma Cancer in 1999 when I was also a brand new mom. I had the tumor while I was pregnant. My brother had also been diagnosed with this same cancer years prior, and he wasn’t fortunate enough to make it, he passed away at age 27. Given my family history, I was terrified.

My late brother in family photo growing up. 

Making homemade broth and sipping that in the morning became part of my daily protocol back to health.  My friends and family noticed the benefits I was receiving and wanted in but they could not do the soup like a daily cup of coffee like me. So, I looked for other ways for them to get the same nutrients & benefits in food and couldn’t find anything. So I set out to bring these nutrients to the world in a trusting and delicious way for them & everyone to consume. 

As a bone broth maker myself, I know the importance of using Pasture Raised & Grass-Fed bones for the nutrients. I am so proud to be sourcing from European Grass Fed & Pasture Raised animals with no antibiotics or hormones & humanely raised. This was not an easy feat! I spent hours making phone calls and meeting with people all over the world. I worked hard and built great relationships with Ph.D. Biochemists, ranchers, nutrition experts and doctors. 

Shopping at the local organic farm.

The end result: We were able to bring delicious, quality bone broth collagen protein bars to market. My team is amazing. Everyone involved from the manufacturer, the raw material companies, entire staff and all the outsourced professionals who truly care. I feel blessed to be here for my kids with the 2nd chance at life and honored to pay it forward. We are so proud to be part of the movement to provide transparent nutrition for generations to come!

My kids Brandon & Grace with me today

It takes a VILLAGE to launch a successful company 

Being one person making it happen, I cannot do this alone, I need amazing staff, friends, family, and community coming together for a greater purpose.. supporting better health choices, educating the world on better health habits which we are doing through our blog, cross promoting with other great health food brands and standing behind HealingStrong.

Building great relationships with healthcare providers

As well as building an amazing team to help support & execute the vision.

Meet the Yonder team:

Sheri Geoffreys - Founder & CEO:  Experience in sales, branding, corporate photography, creative director, and marketing as well as a successful Entrepreneur.   4 years of health blogging backed into Yonder's website with strong health knowledge as a passionate researcher getting her own health back on track.  Driven by intense passion and positive energy.  A "Health Nerd" & dedicated mom, strong faith, enjoys giving back and plans on fueling a few ministries once established. 

Hanna Lane - Brand Manager & Bus Dev:  Worked at Perfect Bar in Natural food space. Marketing, social media, business development experience. Great at cultivating influencers & relationships on every level. Nimble and hungry, willing to do whatever it takes. Strong health knowledge. Heart of gold, strong faith, loyal companion, dog lover, amazing wife and a dedicated member of Yonder.  "Health Nerd". 

Our Manufacturer & Co-Packer & Advisor: An N.D., H.M.D Board Certified Naturopathic Physician. State of the art Pharmaceutical Grade Nutraceutical Manufacturing facility with European Standards is cGMP and HACCP Compliant, has Superior Rating 3rd Party.

Michel Algazi CEO Founder - Food Centricity:  Advisor/Consultant: Assisting us with our business plan, velocity numbers, margins, costing, financial modeling, strategic go to market strategy, execution, brand positioning. He spent 27+ years building lasting consumer and food & beverage brands at Fortune 500 companies and entrepreneurial environments in the US and internationally. He has a proven record of leveraging emerging technologies to grow new and existing businesses through strategic acumen and creative brand-building. He is former CEO of Freshology, a leader in the delivery or freshly-made and nutritionally-balanced meals.

Rob Spinelli VP of Sales/Business at Sambazon: Advisor. Rob has extensive experience with national & global sales in CPG space (Food & Beverage)  and took his last company from 30M to well over 100M in 3 yrs. He was recently brought on to join Sambazon's team to grow them to great heights. Prior, North America Gen Mgr Bus Dev at Torani, Sr. Dir of Business Development at Pepsi, Dir of Marketing at Taco Bell.

Brad Ebenhoeh at Accountfully Our Outsourced Accounting Firm: CPA's, big 6 accounting background. Specialize in the Natural Food CPG Space, startups pre-revenue. Knowledgeable on costing, supply chain, inventory, interfacing all channels into accounting. 

Risks & Challenges

Our Blueberry Nut and Coconut Almond Bars we have in stock now and those will ship within 4 business days. 

For any of the previous Peanut Butter Chocolate Chip Bars we are padding time until we can produce our 1st official run to have inventory of that flavor, however, at times some raw materials are back ordered since we source only the best, we do not want to compromise. In case there are any delays, we will keep you posted! These statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration nor are intended to diagnose, treat, cure or prevent any disease.
story_txt: We are OFFERING OUR PILOT RUN SAMPLE BARS AS PERKS to share the love, get more feedback and to show the interest in the market.   Our 1st test pilot run was SUCCESSFUL! We are branded, 3rd party tested, doctor approved and ready to roll!  I am a cancer survivor on a mission to provide transparent nutrient dense Bone Broth Collagen Bars/Snacks with 14+ grams of protein, 8 grams of grass-fed collagen and only 2g-3g of sugar from organic sources. I need a low sugar diet, and ingredients like Rice and Gums run havoc on my gut! I also drink bone broth collagen every morning like a cup of coffee. My friends and family wanted to have the bone broth nutrients but were not going to drink it like a soup. I started to look on the market for solutions and I couldn't find anything and so YONDER was born! Why not bring a passion for healthy snacks to reality for the whole world to enjoy!What You GetYou can get our PILOT RUN bars right away, 2 flavors available: Wild Blueberry Nut & Coconut Almond.We CareWe care about you, your health, the environment, and ensuring the transparency and quality of our products. Paying it forward for generations to come! story:
Overview

Maybe you’ve heard about us from a friend who’s been raving about our mead. Or you could be a big fan, reading every email, following us on Instagram and liking every post. Or maybe you're new to mead and aren’t sure where to start. Whatever the case, we’re glad you found us.

Our love for mead started as a slow growing obsession and has now become a full blown passion. We go to great efforts to reinvent flavors not easily found or never seen as a mead before. We’re known for our sweet, full bodied flavors packed with unconventional, real ingredients, We’ve even shoved shortbread cookies in a mead because imitation flavors didn’t taste the same. How many times have you bought a cinnamon roll stout and been disappointed because it was more like a watery oatmeal porter? If we promise a flavor on the label, that’s what the mead inside will taste like.

By continually innovating our recipes, we are proof that mead doesn’t always have to abide by medieval or ancient standards. Mead can transport you to a warm beach day in Mexico, tea time in England, or your grandma’s kitchen full of fresh baked pie. If you’ve dreamed of drinking your desserts, we’re right up your alley. If you prefer smooth mixed drinks, we’re probably a good choice for you too. Our meads have been described as phenomenal, unique, honey-forward, dangerously good, unconventional, and a craft drinkers dream. We look forward to launching in 2019 and sharing our passion with you.

 

What We Need & What You Get

The reason why we’re here is to ask you to support us and our ideas. The funds we raise from this campaign will go towards:

  • Remaining start up costs: legal fees and licensing costs
  • Purchasing equipment: bottlers, labeling and capping machines
  • Quality ingredients: we use Tahitian vanilla in every mead and the price per bean keeps increasing
  • Acquiring barrels for the Mielmigos Society barrel-aged mead series

The Mielmigos Society Membership

If you want to guarantee that you’ll get your hands on our mead, head on over to the perks column and choose that 1-year membership perk.

So what do you get for joining the Mielmigos Society?

  • Gain exclusive access to (8) 750ml swingtop bottles of rare, barrel-aged and small batch meads. These will be released as they become available starting in mid-2019.* There will be four different meads, and members receive 2 bottles of each.
  • Collaborate and provide feedback on the flavors of Mielmigos Society meads
  • Member Glass
  • Member Shirt
  • Member Gift Card
  • Also includes leather patch hat, bottle opener and sticker sheet (all merch valued at $100)

Mielmigos Society meads will be pick up only at Dry County Brewing and the first release is expected midyear. However, all merch will ship out in March. 

About the Mielmigos Society Meads

We plan on crafting medium sweet to sweet melomels and metheglins aged in hand-picked barrels. Packaged in a 750ml swingtop bottle. 

Example Meads:

  • Vanilla blueberry aged in bourbon barrels
  • Rye cherry mocha aged in rye barrels
  • Orange cherry vanilla aged in Blantons tequila barrels

*Subject to change depending on barrel availability.

**To comply with state laws, members will purchase their bottles at the bottle release event. We are including a member gift card in your welcome box to cover the cost of the bottles. Releases will be announced  at a later date and everyone will be kept in the loop as our membership program evolves.

The "Half Pint" Membership

LIMITED TIME - Choose this perk to receive access to *1 bottle each* of our 4 Mielmigos Society meads. (Mielmigos Society meads will be packaged in a 750ml swingtop bottle). Also includes merch ($100 value) and first right to refusal for regular meads.

Other Perks

In addition to our Mielmigos Society membership, we've designed some pretty cool perks we hope you’ll like.

First, we have a 90s inspired sticker sheet featuring label art from some of our favorite meads including Princess Lily, Island Sun, Illegal Leopard and Stake Your Pain. The individual stickers are perfect size for a laptop or beer fridge.

If you love custom art then you'll definitely want our mead-stronaut bottle opener. The astronaut theme has two meanings to us - we approach meadmaking with an open mind, ready to explore new and undiscovered flavors. It also represents our initiative to invite others to discover (or rediscover) mead.

Next we have our 12oz stemless tumbler glass. Its curved base is perfectly balanced to allow for swirling, sniffing and tasting your drink of choice. 

Moving into apparel, we've selected a soft tri-blend shirt that showcases our slogan "Unconventional. Imaginative. Artistic." It's pre-washed and super soft, making it one of our favorites.

Last of all, our leather patch logo hat. This premium structured cap features an adjustable plastic snap tab for the perfect fit and our logo debossed onto a leather patch made in the USA. Each level includes the previous perks so you don't have to pick your favorite; choose the Nightcap level and get them all.

 

Risks & Challenges

Luckily, our partnership with Dry County Brewing means we will have immediate access to the brewery's equipment, so once we’re licensed we can begin production. We will keep you updated on our licensing status over the next couple months.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you’re broke from last month’s bottle release or Christmas, you can still help us out. Use Indiegogo’s built-in share tools to post our campaign and tell your booze-loving friends about the next big thing in craft beverages. We appreciate all of your support so far and look forward to kicking things off in 2019.

Cheers,

Randall and Haley Dolan

story:
Update!

We're almost to our goal but we still need the community's support! $5k is the minimum we need to get started. Anything above that will help us with funds to deck out the truck, get better kitchen equipment, and start investing in marketing, merchandising, and promotions. 

 

Who We Are

Anarchy Burgers is a punk rock food truck concept years in the making. Enough of the same old burgers! We’re bringing burgers to Reno that’ll make you salivate and question what the meaning of a burger really is. We will destroy boring food experiences while supporting the local music scene. Great food. Great punk rock.

Meet the partners! Anarchy Burgers is two couples: Ashley & Barry Friedberg and Kristen & Tim Blake. The Friedbergs are an All-American family trying to live the American anarchy dream. Barry has been in the SoCal and Reno punk and skate scene since 1979 and has been working in food service for over 15 years. He specializes in burgers and sauces. Barry will be teaming up with wife Ashley, good girl gone punk and working mom with a background in accounting, along with their four burger slinging kids. The Blakes are all-out food fiends, constantly on the prowl for the next great bite. Tim is a veteran of the Reno punk scene, craft beer snob enthusiast, and business owner with a passion for fixing people’s ears. When he’s not playing music, eating, or drinking good beer, he’s out making custom ear plugs for local and touring bands. Kristen is an experimental home cook with a background in food service and marketing. She loves science and food equally, so you never know what experiment is going to come out of the kitchen. 

What We Need & What You Get

Anarchy Burgers needs to raise $5k to get on the road and ready to sling burgers. An additional $5k will be invested by the partners. The partners have invested $3500 in making this a reality so far. We have purchased the truck and made necessary repairs so that it is now up and running! We’ve also salvaged some stainless steel paneling for the inside and got a great deal on the stove. We’ve also already started investing in merchandising. 

Our reward merchandise (shirts, hats, patches, buttons, stickers) use only the best quality inks and materials and all the printing and merchandising is done here locally in Reno. 

Want to donate and have a reward in mind? Hit us up! We’re flexible and into collaboration!

How we will use funds raised here

  • truck fabrication and welding
  • kitchen equipment (fryers, sinks, prep tables, fridge)
  • kitchen tools
  • licenses and fees 
  • rent a prep kitchen
  • merchandise
  • foodstuffs to get rollin’

Other Ways You Can Help

Have any skills you think might help out Anarchy Burgers? Hit us up! We love collaboration. 

Want Anarchy Burgers to roll-up on your bar, brewery, or other business? Let us know!

Spread the Word!

Share our Indiegogo on Facebook and Instagram! Tell all your friends!

We love Reno and the local small business community here!

Keep it local and keep it weird Reno!

Thank you so much for all your support!

 

Awesome video shot and edited by Travis Calvert and Ford Corl!!! Thanks guys!
